intro: Jonesiopsis brevisura, commonly known as the short-sheath Jonesiopsis, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its small, palmate leaves that are typically clustered at the base of the plant. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by small, berry-like fruits. Native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and endangered species in its native range.
